newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Teva Q1 earnings per ADR $0.51.
newsitem.headline: Teva Q1 earnings per ADR $0.51.

text.p: (in thousands of dollars except per ADR data)
Teva, Israel's largest drug company, declared a regular first interim cash dividend for 1997 of 0.30 shekels ($0.09) per ADR to be paid on June 12.

Teva said the 1997 and 1996 results reflected the acquisition of Biocraft Laboratories Inc in May 1996. The 1996 comparative figures do not include the results of APS/Berk which was acquired in July 1996.
Sales outside of Israel represented 71 percent of total revenues in the first quarter of 1997. North America remains Teva's largest market, representing close to half its revenues.

"The company's ability to increase its sales level in the American market, continuing price erosion not withstanding, has been attributable to the introduction of a number of new products," Teva said in a statement.
Since the beginning of the year the company has received six generic approvals in the United States.

European sales for the quarter rose to $47 million from $35 million, accounting for 18 percent of total sales. This increase was primarily attributable to the acquisition of APS/Berk in the United Kingdom.
Gross profit margins improved to 40.7 percent from 36.2 percent.
Gross research and development expenses fell 11 percent to $17 million.
